page.title: 04Manor Farm Fire
page.content: Fire destroyed the 17th Century thatched house at Manor Farm Activity Centre early on May 18th 1985 when an electrical fault set light to the attic. Barking dogs raised the alarm and the ten occupants escaped unharmed. There were no holiday makers in residence.Seven fire engines fought the fire with water from the Centre's swimming pool and the river Brue. Sqdn Ldr Gilchrist lost his flight log books and favourite photographs but much of the ground floor furniture was saved.The visitors dormitory block was undamaged and courses continue as usual. It is hoped to rebuild the house by Christmas,this time preferably with a tiled roof if the planning authorities agree.
